entry.title: OneLove (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Dutch campaign OneLove (logo pictured) inspired football captains to wear rainbow armbands at the 2020 and 2022 European Championships?

entry.title: Saleh Djasit (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Saleh Djasit was the first member of the Indonesian People's Representative Council to be arrested by the Corruption Eradication Commission?

entry.title: 1945–1946 Charleston Cigar Factory strike (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that according to The Atlantic, "the first widely acknowledged performance" of the song "We Shall Overcome" occurred during the 1945–1946 Charleston Cigar Factory strike?

entry.title: Evgeny Sviridov (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Russian violinist Evgeny Sviridov, who has been concertmaster of the Baroque ensemble Concerto Köln since 2015, has made an award-winning recording of sonatas by Giuseppe Tartini?

entry.title: Ryukyu Arc (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that at the Ryukyu Arc, the Philippine Sea Plate is subducting under the Eurasian Plate at 5 to 7 cm (2.0 to 2.8 in) per year?

entry.title: Richard Draper (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Richard Draper, printer of the The Massachusetts Gazette, used this newspaper as a Loyalist voice as the American Revolution drew near?

entry.title: purchased for 20 times above the market price (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that pillows were purchased for 20 times above the market price in Rooppur Nuclear Power Plant's housing complex?

entry.title: Marriage License (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that betrothed couple Moe and Joan were paid $50 for helping a painter with his Marriage License?
